meanings.definition: Behaving in an overly showy or pretentious manner.
meanings.sent1: She wore a poncy hat to the party, trying to impress everyone.
meanings.sent2: The mansion was decorated in a poncy style, with gold everywhere.
meanings.sent3: His poncy walk made his friends laugh, thinking he was pretending to be a model.
meanings.sent4: The peacock strutted around the farm, its feathers looking poncy in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The queen's crown was so poncy, it sparkled like a thousand stars.

meanings.definition: Characterized by excessive elegance or luxury.
meanings.sent1: The hotel room was so poncy, with velvet curtains and a chandelier.
meanings.sent2: Her poncy dress shimmered under the lights of the ballroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched out on the poncy velvet sofa, looking quite comfortable.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in poncy shades of pink and gold.
meanings.sent5: The poncy yacht sailed gracefully across the crystal-clear waters.

meanings.definition: A person who is affectedly refined or pretentious.
meanings.sent1: She acted like a poncy, always talking about expensive brands.
meanings.sent2: The poncy at the art gallery turned up his nose at the abstract paintings.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to be a poncy, sipping her juice with a pinky up.
meanings.sent4: The peacock strutted around like a poncy, showing off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent5: The poncy at the party only socialized with people of high status.
